rev::ShaderProgram Class Reference

Class representing an openGL shader program @detailed Note that QT's abstraction of the shader program is bizarre... "I can't tell what's worse: that they made setAttributeBuffer a member of a type that has absolutely nothing to do with vertex state". More...

#include <GShaderProgram.h>

Detailed Description

Class representing an openGL shader program @detailed Note that QT's abstraction of the shader program is bizarre... "I can't tell what's worse: that they made setAttributeBuffer a member of a type that has absolutely nothing to do with vertex state".

Member Function Documentation

◆ bind()

void rev::ShaderProgram::bind ( )

Get the the given uniform.

starts the program @detailed upon binding, any uniforms in the queue will be updated

◆ bindUniformBlock()

void rev::ShaderProgram::bindUniformBlock ( const QString &  blockName)
protected

Bind the specified shader uniform block to the specified binding point.

See: https://learnopengl.com/Advanced-OpenGL/Advanced-GLSL

Copy uniforms from specified shader program to this one.

◆ getUniformBlockIndex()

uint32_t rev::ShaderProgram::getUniformBlockIndex ( const QString &  blockName)
protected

Get the uniform block index of the specified UBO.

See: https://learnopengl.com/Advanced-OpenGL/Advanced-GLSL

Note
It is assumed that uniform block names are consistent across all shaders and UBOs

◆ namespaceName()

virtual const char* rev::ShaderProgram::namespaceName ( ) const
inlinevirtual

The full namespace for this class.

Every subclass should redefine/override this property to return its full namespace. The built in logging methods will use this value for the message category

Reimplemented from rev::Object.

◆ m_shaders

std::vector<Shader> rev::ShaderProgram::m_shaders
protected
